edu.cmu.cs.lti.discoursedb.io.prosolo.socialactivity.io

Class ProsoloDB

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.cmu.cs.lti.discoursedb.io.prosolo.socialactivity.io.ProsoloDB

  • public class ProsoloDB
extends Object
    Establishes a JDBC database connection to a prosolo database and provides methods to access ProSolo data using the POJOs in the model package.
    Author:
    Oliver Ferschke

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ProsoloDB(String host, String db, String user, String pwd)
      Creates a databse access object for accessing prosolo data from a MySQL database.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ProsoloDB

        public ProsoloDB(String host,
                 String db,
                 String user,
                 String pwd)
        Creates a databse access object for accessing prosolo data from a MySQL database.
        Parameters:
        host - host of the prosolo db
        db - prosolo database
        user - username with read access to the prosolo db
        pwd - user password

    • Method Detail

      • getIdsForDtype

        public List<Long> getIdsForDtype(String dtype)
                          throws SQLException
        Returns all ids for social activities of the given dtype. This idlist can then be used to query one social activity at a time in a separate PreparedStatement. This might be preferred to streaming a whole resultset (even though this would have a higher performance), because no other statements can be executed before the (streaming) query isn't closed.
        Parameters:
        dtype - the dtype for the social activity
        Returns:
        a list of ids for social activities of the provided dtype
        Throws:
        SQLException

      • getIdsForDtypeAndAction

        public List<Long> getIdsForDtypeAndAction(String dtype,
                                          String action)
                                   throws SQLException
        Returns all ids for social activities of the given dtype. This idlist can then be used to query one social activity at a time in a separate PreparedStatement. This might be preferred to streaming a whole resultset (even though this would have a higher performance), because no other statements can be executed before the (streaming) query isn't closed.
        Parameters:
        dtype - the dtype for the social activity
        action - the action for this activity (e.g. TwitterPost, Post)
        Returns:
        a list of ids for social activities of the provided dtype
        Throws:
        SQLException

      • getIdsForFollowedEntityType

        public List<Long> getIdsForFollowedEntityType(String dtype)
                                       throws SQLException
        Returns all ids for followed entities of the given dtype. This idlist can then be used to query one followed_entity at a time in a separate PreparedStatement. This might be preferred to streaming a whole resultset (even though this would have a higher performance), because no other statements can be executed before the (streaming) query isn't closed.
        Parameters:
        dtype - the dtype for the followed entity
        Returns:
        a list of ids for followed entities of the provided dtype
        Throws:
        SQLException

        Parameters:

        Returns:

        Returns:

                                     throws SQLException
        Returns a single ProsoloUser object
        Parameters:
        id - the id of the prosolo user
        Returns:
        an optional ProsoloUser object that is empty if the id did not exist in the database

      • mapProsoloUserIdToedXUsername

        public Optional<String> mapProsoloUserIdToedXUsername(Long id)
                                               throws SQLException
        Returns the edX username for a given ProSolo user id.
        Parameters:
        id - the prosolo user id
        Returns:
        an Optional containing the edX username of the prosolo user with the provided id, if a mapping exists
        Throws:
        SQLException

                                        throws SQLException

        Parameters:

        Returns:
